entries.meaning: (dated) A female domestic servant, especially one employed for menial work.
examples: And then Somerset looked at the boysâ€² skivvy, and saw a well set up young woman with a red round face, an angry face just then but underneath the anger a pleasant one.

entries.meaning: (US, Australia, New Zealand) A close-fitting, long-sleeved T-shirt with a rolled collar.
examples: I put my wetsuit and skivvy on a tree to dry, and laid out my other gear on some grass.

verbs.description: skivvy (third-person singular simple present skivvies, present participle skivvying, simple past and past participle skivvied)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To perform menial work; to do chores, like a servant.
